metadata.bijbeltekst: Ephesians 4:13; 1 Timothy 6:11; Isaiah 66:1; Matthew 6:9; Exodus 3:5; Psalm 22:3; Isaiah 6:3; Revelation 4:8

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer seeks to acquire and manifest the quality of 'reverence' to achieve full spiritual growth and maturity in Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: I want to speak of another quality which I think must characterize and saturate all of these other traits.
I think I must ask myself, 'Am I reverent...?'
We had better go back and understand that Jesus says we must come to a reverence.
A character which at last can be truly called Christian.
Reverence, due regard for what is holy.

zender.identificatie: The Church / The Preacher (as arbiter of growth)
tekstueel_bewijs: The purpose of what we do here in this church is to help bring us each to our full growth.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Believer (self-improvement) and God (as recipient of worship)
tekstueel_bewijs: To help us on to God, to put on Christ fully in our words and in our work.

helper.identificatie: Jesus (as model/pattern) and The Church (as environment)
tekstueel_bewijs: The prayer our Lord gave us as a model and a pattern.
Anything said or done here which will help us.
Public filth in our recorded material.
Vulgarity is palmed off as art.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as a cultural decline into 'looseness' and 'vulgarity' rather than a cosmic or ontological power like Sin or Death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's holiness and self-existence as the objective reality to which the subject must respond.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: God's being provides the 'reason' for the primary program, but the primary program (human effort to be reverent) remains the engine of the sermon.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has put something of himself in us.
God demands and receives my unqualified reverence.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must come to a reverence.
I must look upon you with a certain respect.
We too often reward spoken garbage with a smile.

voorbeelden: A quality which I think must characterize...
We must each one day appear.
We had better go back and understand.
Makes us want to confess and to give thanks.
I want to speak of another quality.
We know some of these qualities.
I refer to reverence... an appropriate attitude.
Who could not pull ourselves up to him.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Devoir). It assumes that by knowing (Savoir) the definition of reverence and the nature of God, the hearer can and must produce the required attitude.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the lack of S1 in culture (Niet-S1) toward the necessity of S1 by contemplating the majesty of God (S1) as opposed to the filth of the world (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the human act of 'bowing down' (Subject performance).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a social/moral nuisance rather than a spiritual death-trap.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high-exaltation language for God, the 'Subject' of the narrative is consistently the human being striving to achieve a 'quality' (reverence) to reach 'full growth.' God is the Object of reverence, not the Subject of the transformation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The purpose of what we do here... is to help bring us each to our full growth.
The prayer our Lord gave us as a model and a pattern.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has put something of himself in us.
Drawing near to us who could not pull ourselves up to him.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as a 'pattern' for prayer, and the Jewish people/Mother/Boy Scouts are used as models of the desired quality.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Instead of 'Be reverent like Moses,' a theocentric reading would be 'God hallows the ground for Moses, making a way for the sinner to stand in His presence.'

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; a sense of inadequacy regarding their 'supply' of reverence.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is a human project aided by divine examples.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is logically coherent as a call to virtue, but theologically inconsistent in its closing where it mentions we 'could not pull ourselves up' yet spends the entire text telling us to do exactly that.
spanning_punten: The tension between God's absolute transcendence and the human requirement to 'put on Christ' by effort.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus gave us a model and a pattern.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not mentioned as the source of 'Pouvoir' (Power); the hearer must generate reverence through contemplation.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as vulgarity, flippancy, and cultural decay rather than a condition of the heart requiring death and resurrection.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Recruitment' narrative, trying to move the hearer's 'Vouloir' (Will) toward a 'Devoir' (Duty). God is the majestic landscape, but the hearer is the traveler.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The believer is the subject of 'growing' and 'revering.'
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We must come to a reverence,' use 'The Holy Spirit creates in us a heart of awe by revealing the majesty of Christ.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the one who must 'not stunt growth.'
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Position the hearer as the one who receives holiness from the Holy One.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Gospel enables reverence where the Law only demands it.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the 'Opponent' as the radical pride that refuses to acknowledge God's holiness.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a serious opponent, grace is not needed, only better manners.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God hallows us in Christ) must precede Ethics (We live reverently).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a beautiful grasp of the 'Object' (God's Holiness) but lacks the 'Subject' (God's Action) to make it a sermon of Grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is eloquent and persuasive; semiotically, it is a work-centered mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Isaiah is accurate regarding God's nature, but the homiletical application shifts the actantial weight to the human response.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'Holy, Holy, Holy' content, the 'engine' of the sermon is the hearer's self-improvement.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'High-Church Moralism'—exalting God's character to increase the weight of the human duty to respect Him.
